definitions.definition: Synonym of pure and virtuous , particularly

subdefinitions.definition: Sexually pure , abstaining from immoral or unlawful sexual intercourse .
examples: Theirs was a chaste marriage, loving and content.

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of celibate , abstaining from any sexual intercourse .
examples: Theirs was a chaste marriage, cold and sexless.

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of virginal , innocent , having or providing no sexual knowledge or experience .
examples: Her upbringing had been so chaste that her first experience French kissing ended in a panicked dash to the Piggly Wiggly to buy a home pregnancy test, just in case.

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of modest , particularly ( sexism ) in reference to behavior expected of sexually pure women .
examples: I ask again what reason could a chaste woman possibly have for being out so late? and in that part of town? Your Honor, we repeat our motion that you recuse yourself from this case.

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of austere , plain , unextravagant , particularly demure , sexually discreet .
examples: The chaste style of most early modern novels is elegant but intensely boring, particularly for teenagers too inexperienced to effectively read between the lines .

main_definition: Synonym of pure and virtuous , particularly
